title: High-power European broadband satellite set for launch from French Guiana
summary: An Ariane 5 rocket is set to blast off Wednesday from French Guiana — a day later than planned due to a poor weather forecast Tuesday — with a Eutelsat-owned satellite designed to beam broadband internet signals across Europe from a position in geostationary orbit.

title: Aerospace opens $100 million facility in Colorado Springs for military space activities
summary: Aerospace Corp. unveiled a 90,000-square-foot Space Warfighting Center to provide high-tech tools for military space agencies

title: DoD updates space policy, formally adopts ‘tenets of responsible behavior’
summary: The Defense Department released an updated policy document that recognizes space “as a priority domain of national military power” and formally adopts rules for safe operations in space.

title: Astounding new Webb image reveals tens of thousands of young stars
summary: This stellar nursery is located in the Large Magellanic Cloud.

title: European space chief “cannot see” a return to cooperation with Russia
summary: "We cannot work with a partner who is completely trampling on those values."

title: South Korean lunar orbiter succeeds in critical trajectory correction maneuver
summary: South Korea’s first robotic lunar orbiter is looping back to the moon from the L1 Lagrange point after successfully conducting a critical trajectory correction maneuver Sept. 2, a milestone in its voyage toward the moon.

title: China performs two launches inside two hours
summary: China conducted its 36th and 37th orbital launches of 2022 within a couple of hours of each other starting late Monday.

title: Starlink Maritime deployed on the most Instagrammed superyacht
summary: Starlink Maritime has been deployed on the world’s most Instagrammed superyacht,  Motor Yacht Loon. Loon has an Instagram following of almost 62,000...

title: Research, spacewalks, and maintenance: Expedition 67’s final month aboard the ISS
summary: The seven members of the Expedition 67 crew aboard the International Space Station (ISS) had yet another action-packed month in August 2022. From spacewalks to research to cargo vehicle departures, the crew aboard the orbiting laboratory and mission teams back on Earth stayed busy.

title: Space Force extends Saber Astronautics’ contract for space visualization software
summary: Saber Astronautics announced Sept. 5 the U.S. Space Force has extended the company’s contract to develop a space domain awareness tool designed for satellite operators.
